master.commit_message: rtd: formats is separate, not part of sphinx

rtd: Add the .readthedocs.yaml config file

This will be required after September 25, 2023
See https://blog.readthedocs.com/migrate-configuration-v2/

spec: Update spec with changes from Fedora

- Run tests by default
- Use SPDX license names
- Use LC_ALL=C during tests for consistent results
Makefile: Update pypi upload command
New release: 3.48

Makefile: Add a test-no-coverage target

Fedora doesn't want to run coverage during rpm builds, so make a new
target that just runs the tests and adjust the example .spec.in file
accordingly.

realm: switch from pipes.quote() to shlex.quote()

The 'pipes' module was marked deprecated in Python 3.11, slated for
removal in Python 3.13 [1]. The only bit of it used was pipes.quote(),
which can be easily replaced by shlex.quote(), as it is also implemented
in the 'pipes' module.

[1] https://peps.python.org/pep-0594/#pipes
workflow: Update actions to newest versions

Fix issues how to generate encrypted passwords

Introduce a better option but keep a fixed version of the old code example for older distributions
Fixes #451
New release: 3.47

network: Move new options to Fedora 39

These will not be implemented in F38, move them to F39.

--ipv4-dns-search
--ipv6-dns-search
--ipv4-ignore-auto-dns
--ipv6-ignore-auto-dns

Related: rhbz#1656662

displaymode: Update description to describe behavior

The displaymode commands (text, cmdline, graphical) control the mode
during the installation, and the mode that the system will boot into by
default. This updates the description to correctly reflect that
behavior.
New release: 3.46

Add conflict test between ostree sources (#2125655)

This will forbid use of ostreesetup and ostreecontainer together.

Related: rhbz#2125655

Fix missing seen check for output generation (#2125655)

This wasn't an issue before because it was the only supported source.
However, with two sources for the same payload we are getting generated
both lines all the time.

Related: rhbz#2125655

Add new ostreecontainer command (#2125655)

It is another way to set source for ostree.

The difference:
ostreesetup - work for OSTree repositories
ostreecontainer - work for native container images

See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Changes/OstreeNativeContainer for
more details.

Changes:
The ostree tool renamed `osname` to `stateroot` so when we creating a
new command let's make the name correct.

The default value is recommended on BZ and here
https://github.com/ostreedev/ostree/issues/2794

Related: rhbz#2125655

Rename osname to stateroot and set default value (#2125655)

The ostree tool renamed `osname` to `stateroot` so when we creating a
new command let's make the name correct.

The default value is recommended on BZ and here
https://github.com/ostreedev/ostree/issues/2794

Related: rhbz#2125655

Check the conflicting commands automatically

If the command, that is going to be parsed, defines any conflicting commands,
the kickstart handler will check them first and raise an exception if there
is a conflict. This happens automatically now.

Fix tests for conflicting commands

Test conflicts on sequences of commands with the CommandSequenceTest class.

Add conflicting commands support

Previously a command would have to implement checking the .seen
attribute on commands that it conflicts with, and manually update the
command description with the commands that it could not be used with.

With this change you can implement command conflict support by adding a
list to the class:

  conflictingCommands = ["raid", "reqpart"]

Pass this list to the command's KSOptionParser as ``conflicts``:

  KSOptionParser(..., conflicts=self.conflictingCommands)

And then in the first version that the conflict occurs, call the helper
function with a translated error message from the ``parse`` function:

  self._checkConflictingCommands(_("The %s and autopart commands can't be used at the same time"))

the command's description will have a list of the conflicting commands
appended to it automatically.

Fix handling of package section arguments in older versions

The %package section argument were changed in F32 to prefer the
non-camelcase form. But when using an older version they should be
output using the old form, not the new one.

Fixes #444
New release: 3.45
workflow: Update to use released python 3.11 version

Don't allow to use --sdboot and --extlinux together

Only one of --sdboot and --extlinux may be specified for bootloader command.

tests: add bootloader sdboot option

Now that there is a --sdboot option lets verify
that the option parse/set routines work.

Signed-off-by: Jeremy Linton <jeremy.linton@arm.com>

bootloader: Add systemd-boot support with --sdboot

Extend the bootloader command with the ability to
utilize systemd-boot as the bootloader on EFI systems.

Signed-off-by: Jeremy Linton <jeremy.linton@arm.com>

Add %changelog section to pykickstart.spec.in

The section is blank which is totally fine but without the section the
build will fail. With blank section it's just a warning.

I totally agree that changelog shouldn't be part of the upstream spec
file, however, without it complicates the build.

Do not request sign for rc-release Makefile target

Without this the rc-release Makefilet target is doomed to fail. The
point is that it requires creation of the tarball but won't give you an
opportunity to do the signing yourself before starting to consume
created tarball.

To fix this make the signing optional in spec file and build without the
sign verification.

Do not require SPECFILE for rc-release

It should be almost always this file and also rc-release Makefile target
requires `pykickstart.spec` as target so the file is created during
process.

This change is not required but it's nice usability improvement.

Add missing docs copy to scratch Makefile

This file is required by spec file so without it the tarball is not
complete.
Add support for Fedora 39
New release: 3.44

Add DNS handling options to the network command

This adds four new options to control handling of DNS:

--ipv4-dns-search
--ipv6-dns-search
--ipv4-ignore-auto-dns
--ipv6-ignore-auto-dns

Related: rhbz#1656662

Fix the coverage report

The coverage report says "No data to report" after running the unit tests.
It can be fixed with the removal of the `--include` option. Since the coverage
is collected with the `--source=pykickstart,tools` option, there are no other
data anyway.
whitelist_externals has changed to allowlist_externals

Update %post example for DNS problems

Use the example from Anaconda's docs, and point to them.

Fixes #429

deps: Move dependencies into requirements.txt

Something changed and tox with python 3.7 and later no longer installs
the deps from setup.py using "deps = .[docs, test]" so fall back to
using "deps = -rrequirements.txt" instead.

This should fix the PR test runs.

Fix syntax of a code sample

With reStructuredText the :: after example already start a code block.
This makes the backticks redundant and are shown in the rendered
documentation.
